page.title: 11St Annes - Local News
page.content: Sea Front seriously disrupted by laying Â£8 million new sewer scheme. Day out in St Annes will cost a family of four just over Â£29 this summer (increase of 8%) although seafront parking again free. Hope remains for threatened War Memorial Hospital. Petition aimed at saving it topped 7,000.Tourists warned about risking lives in Ribble Estuary using cheap rubber dinghies and air-beds.Wind- Surfers advised to sail in groups. check weather and tides and not venture out too far.St Annes needs more evening fun,believes local Holiday Association president especially if weather poor.Often little on offer except local 'pubs' or an expensive,time-consuming visit to Blackpool.
